content: library socks i love having socks on the needles that are easy to pick up whenever i have time to knit just a few row or to bring with me on the go these socks are knit using a super easy-to-remember pattern with gorgeous texture that will show off any type of yarn - speckled tonal or self-striping they are just as easy to knit as vanilla socks but a lot more fun and result in a better fit too as i was knitting these socks the little blocks reminded me of library books stacked on a shelf besides isn t knitting and reading the best pastime ever so grab your needles some yarn from your stash and get ready to cast on size approx foot circumference yarn adult medium turtle purl sock yarn in winter s coming 8½ inches or 22 cm 75% superwash merino 25% nylon needles 412 m 450 yd 115 g 2 25 mm or us 1 double pointed needles notions set of 5 tapestry needle stitch marker s or your preferred needles for knitting in the round or on gauge 2 circular needles 32 stitches = approx 10 cm unblocked ___________________________________________________________________________ the pattern is written to be knit with dpns but can be adapted for knitting in the round or with 2 circular needles magic loop if that s your preferred method if you re knitting socks for the first time you may find knitting on circular needles the easiest especially if you have some experience knitting in the round there are a lot of excellent tutorials on youtube for reference no matter which method you use it may be helpful to use a stitch marker or progress keeper to mark the beginning of your round you can also place stitch markers after every 16 stitches to mimic the 4 needles referenced in this pattern note there is no further mention of stitch markers in this pattern so if you use them just slip them from needle to needle as you go along this pattern is written for adult medium size but if you have a bit of experience you can adjust the pattern to make a smaller or larger pair of socks 2 © the kitchen sink shop ready to cast on let s go cast on 64 stitches using the long tail cast on method distribute evenly on 4 needles you should have 16 stitches on each needle join in the round carefully making sure you don t twist any stitches cuff k2 p2 for 15 rounds leg of the sock- texture pattern round 1 k 64 round 2 k 64 round 3 *k2 p2* repeat to end of round round 4 *k2 p2* repeat to end of round repeat rounds 1 -4 until you reach your desired leg length you should finish after round 4 heel flap set up the heel flap and heel turn are worked flat in other words not in the round knit across the n1 and n2 continuing
